sen.j: 上杉重房（うえすぎ しげふさ、生没年不詳）は鎌倉時代中期の公家、武士である。
sen.e: Shigefusa UESUGI (it is unknown when he was born and when he died) was a court noble and samurai who lived in the middle of the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 別称を式乾門院蔵人、官位は修理大夫・左衛門督。
sen.e: He was also called Shikikenmonin Kurodo (the chamberlain of shikikenmonin), and his government positions were Shuri no daibu (the master of the office of palace repairs) and Saemon no kami (the captain of the left division of outer palace guards).

sen.j: 子は上杉頼重、山名政氏室。

sen.j: 京都の中級公家であった、左衛門尉勧修寺清房（藤原北家藤原高藤流）の二子として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as the second child of Kiyofusa KAJUJI (originated in FUJIWARA no Takafuji of Hokke (the northen house) of the Fujiwara clan) who was a middle-class court noble in Kyoto and assumed Saemon no jo (a third-ranked officer of the left Division of outer palace guards).

He was the second child of Kiyofusa KAJUJI (a descendant of FUJIWARA no Takafuji of the Northern House (Hokke) of Fujiwara), a mid-ranking court noble from Kyoto who held the position of Saemon-no-jo (Lieutenant of the Left Division of the Outer Palace guards).

He was the second child of Kiyofusa KAJUJI (a descendant of FUJIWARA no Takafuji of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan), a mid-ranking court noble from Kyoto who held the position of Saemon no jo (Lieutenant of the Left Division of the Outer Palace guards).
sen.cmt: 「藤原北家」→統一リストの表記に修正、Saemon-no-joのハイフン消去

sen.j: 1252年（建長4年）、後嵯峨天皇の皇子宗尊親王が鎌倉幕府第6代征夷大将軍に就任するが、重房はその介添えとして共に鎌倉へ下向した。
sen.e: When Prince Munetaka, a son of Emperor Gosaga assumed the sixth seii taishogun (literally, "the great general for subduing the barbarians") in 1252, Shigefusa moved to Kamakura together with the prince as his attendant.
When Prince Munetaka, a son of Emperor Gosaga, became the sixth Shogun in 1252, Shigefusa moved to Kamakura together with the prince to be his attendant.

When Imperial Prince Munetaka, a son of Emperor Gosaga, became the sixth Seii Taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) in 1252, Shigefusa moved to Kamakura together with the prince to be his attendant.
sen.cmt: Imperial Prince Munetakaとし、「鎌倉幕府第6代征夷大将軍」の表記を修正

sen.j: 丹波国何鹿郡上杉庄（京都府綾部市上杉町周辺）を賜り、以後あらたに上杉氏を称した。
sen.e: He was awarded Uesugi-sho, Ikaruga County, Tanba Province (around present Uesugi-cho, Ayabe City, Kyoto Prefecture), and thereafter he used Uesugi as his family name.

sen.j: 1266年（文永3年）、宗尊親王は謀反の疑いにより帰京させられるが、重房はそのまま鎌倉にとどまって武士となり、幕府に仕えた。
sen.e: Prince Munetaka was forced to return to the capital on suspicion of a rebellion in 1266, but he remained in Kamakura to become a samurai and worked for the bakufu.

sen.j: やがて有力御家人足利泰氏に仕える。
sen.e: Later, he became to work for Yasuuji ASHIKAGA, a powerful gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate).

sen.j: 重房の妹（娘？）が足利頼氏の家女房となり、以後、上杉氏は姻戚関係を通じて足利家中で権勢を得るようになった。
sen.e: His younger sister (or his daughter?) became Yoriuji ASHIKAGA's Ie no Nyobo (a lady-in-waiting), and after that, the Uesugi clan became to be dominant in the Ashikaga family through marriage relationships.

sen.j: この婚姻は、足利氏が、もともと公家で朝廷とのコネクションがあった上杉氏を重要視した結果といわれる。
sen.e: The Uesugi clan came from a court noble, and it is said that these marriages were made because the Ashikaga clan put importance on the Uesugi clan's connections with the imperial court.
